flawed_nl_solution:
James earns 20*0.2=$20*0.2=4>>4 less while working his second job
So he earns 20-4=$20-4=13>>13 an hour
At his first job he earns 20*30=$20*30=600>>600
He works 30/2=<<30/2=15>>15 hours at his second job
So he earns 15*13=$15*13=195>>195
So he earns 600+195=$600+195=795>>795 a week

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16.0, not 13.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
